ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was able to develop my written and spoken Spanish skills, as well as my confidence in using the language.
I improved my Spanish speaking ability, and we discussed complex topics like female identity in Spanish
This class really helped me improve on my Spanish. Especially in terms of writing, I think that my ability increased a lot over the course of this class.
How to analyze Spanish literature and write essays in a formal setting
Spanish

New understandings of gender and sexuality within art, Indigenous protest against environmental devastation, and the way truth is distorted to tell certain narratives about immigrants. This class has a GREAT syllabus, I was super engaged by the topics we covered (in a way I wasnt by L3)
Improved confidence, reading skills, and speaking skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really appreciated the asynchronous days. They were very helpful in allowing me to pace myself and structure my learning.

I think that the largest weakness of the course are the in class activities. I think that more opportunities for students to speak in broader class environments would be ideal. I think that the largest strength was the variety of medias consumed in Spanish. We watched videos, read fiction, read news articles, and listened to sound clips.

Strengths: very interesting and engaging themes 
Weakness: the work oftentimes felt like busy work (making videos and slideshows for projects)
The asynchronous days were essential to the class, and greatly improved my learning.

Weaknesses: lots of busy work
Strengths:small class sizes

Maria is an excellent teacher who makes her passion for the course material clear and makes a visible effort to include everyone in course discussions. I really enjoyed this class, and would only suggest using fewer Jamboards.
The class covered many different, diverse, and interesting topics. The assignments were manageable yet challenging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It is a very good introduction to the Spanish language and culture, and I think any student trying to develop their Spanish skills would benefit from taking it.

Yes, if you want to continue learning and improving upon Spanish this is the ideal course. You move away from focus on grammar and instead learn Spanish In a more applicable sense (speaking, reading, ...)
Yes, I do! I think the themes are very interesting and applicable to society's current problem.
If you have to take Spanish
Yes! Maria is a great teacher and this course is super engaging.
Yes! I think it is a great way to improve ones Spanish skills.
